title.narrative: Second Financial Sector Program Cluster - Subprogram 3 (SF)

description.narrative: The FSP II aims to promote the development of a sound, market-based financial system to support resource mobilization and sustainable economic growth. With a growing, resilient, and more efficient financial system as the expected outcome, subprogram 3 will continue the following reform activities: (i) Improve financial intermediation by upgrading the payments, clearance, and settlement system to support growing financial services; enhance market confidence by improving public financial disclosure and establishing a credit information bureau; support market development by establishing an interbank market and tradable government securities; and improving the outreach of microfinance institutions (MFIs) in a sustainable manner. (ii) Enhance resilience of the financial sector by revising and updating the law on banking and financial institutions, and by introducing supportive regulations to strengthen financial activities; tighten prudential supervision and regulations of banks and microfinance institutions; and build on the legal and regulatory foundation by adopting a new law on commercial contracts that includes specific sections on agencies and franchising. (iii) Promote good governance by implementing international initiatives on combating money laundering and the financing of terrorism, by enhancing corporate governance and transparency in the insurance industry, by establishing commercial dispute resolution mechanisms, and by improving the capability and increasing the number of qualified national accountants and auditors. (iv) Enhance efficiency by computerizing the management information system of the National Bank of Cambodia (NBC), as well as by upgrading the skills and capacity of microfinance agencies' staff.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Reports and Recommendations of the President

Improve confidence and financial intermediation by: (i) NBC adopting the updated roadmap for upgrading the payment system and implement the 2009 activities, (ii) NBC issuing a regulation covering interbank repurchase agreement for valuable papers, (iii) NBC introducing regulations to facilitate MFIs access to voluntary deposits from the general public and enhance the provision of credits to MFIs by domestic commercial banks; maintain stability in the financial system by (iv) NBC submitting the amendment law on banking and financial institutions to the Council of Ministers, (v) NBC requiring banks to comply with applicable Basel I core principles for effective bank supervision, (vi) NBC developing a code of conduct for registered moneychangers, (vii) MOC submitting the draft commercial contract law to the Council of Ministers; promote good governance by (viii) MEF submitting the draft revised insurance law to the CoM, (ix) MOC establishing the national arbitration center with appropriate rules and procedures, (x) MEF continuing to provide 70 CPA scholarships annually; and enhance efficiency by (xi) NBC installing the integrated computer systems for its key operating functions and undertake relevant training staff.
